alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 4:11PM MDT until September 03 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Bear burn scar in... Northwestern Carbon County in central Utah... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 411 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Bear Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. There is a debris flow that crossed US 6 at mile marker 228 and has closed US 6 in both directions. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Bear Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Bear Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Gate, Crandall and Bear Canyons. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Bear Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
